prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Claims for Breach of Confidential Business Information

head.label.name: ยง
head.headtext: Actions for Tortious Interference with Contractual Relations

para.paratext: A claim may be brought against third parties for tortious interference with contractual relations where former employees have disclosed confidential business information belonging to the plaintiff. However, such a claim may only succeed where the third party had knowledge that the former employee was breaching his or her express or implied contractual obligation to the employer.[1]
International Tools Ltd. v. Kollar (1966), 56 D.L.R. (2d) 289 at p. 300, [1966] 2 O.R. 201 (H.C.J.), vard 67 D.L.R. (2d) 386, [1968] 1 O.R. 669 (C.A.).
